sense.name: oppose, resist
sense.examples: He bucked the conventional wisdom and took political risks. He bucked the Democratic establishment and declined to support the party's candidate.

sense.name: jump or move violently or jerkily
sense.commentary: Note: Intransitive. Syntax Is: NP[agent] BUCK
sense.examples: The longer you rode that horse, the harder he bucked. I let up on the gas and the car bucked.

sense.name: to strive with determination
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP[agent] BUCK for NP2[goal] Is: BUCK FOR
sense.examples: She's bucking for a promotion. He's bucking for the dean's list. The UNICEF director is bucking for more U.S. aid for the world's children.

sense.name: throw off
sense.examples: The horse bucked me off twice in one lesson!

sense.name: BUCK UP: take courage
sense.examples: Buck up, sweetheart. We'll be home soon. It really bucked me up to have you there.
